thread.title: Tuesday’s Travel News: Faster Border Crossing to Canada; Kabuki Shows in Las Vegas
thread.title_full: Tuesday’s Travel News: Faster Border Crossing to Canada; Kabuki Shows in Las Vegas - The New York Times

author: Elaine Glusac
title: Tuesday’s Travel News: Faster Border Crossing to Canada; Kabuki Shows in Las Vegas
text:
Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
NEW NEXUS LANE AT VERMONT/CANADA BORDER
Members of Nexus , the program that allows prescreened travelers expedited processing at the border between the United States and Canada, can now use a new fast lane at the Interstate 91 border crossing at Stanstead in Quebec from Derby Line in Vermont. The new lane is part of a Nexus expansion plan outlined in the joint Beyond the Border Action Plan in 2011 between the two governments. Applicants pay $50 and go through an interview to receive the Nexus card, which expedites border crossings at many land and marine ports, as well as participating airports with Global Entry kiosks. Currently over 1.2 million travelers have enrolled in Nexus. Aimed at Canada-bound rush-hour traffic, the Stanstead lane will be dedicated to Nexus between 3 and 5 p.m. Monday through Friday, and open to regular crossings at other times.
